Dialogue:
EQ: Hello!  
AJ: Hello!  
EQ: Did you go back to your hometown this year?  
AJ: No, my parents' house is very close, so I didn't. How about you? Did you go back home for Obon?  
EQ: Yes, I went back to my hometown. My husband's mother is elderly.  
AJ: I see. Did you travel by train or car?  
EQ: By car. It was from the 14th to the 17th, so it wasn’t crowded.  
AJ: It's a bit late, but the timing was good. Did you visit gravesites?  
EQ: Since the welcoming fire was done on the 14th, I didn’t go to the grave.  
AJ: Understood. My family doesn't observe traditions like visiting graves or Obon, so I was curious.  
EQ: My family home also had little connection since my father was the fourth son.  
AJ: It seems there are people like that.  
EQ: I wonder if the number of children has anything to do with it.  
AJ: Since the eldest son usually inherits the family line, it matters. Family background also plays a role.  
EQ: Also, do they live outside the prefecture?  
AJ: That's true. When it's close, you end up not going.  
EQ: Don’t you go if it’s close? I can’t go even if it’s far.  
AJ: If it’s far, the only time to go back home is during holidays.  
EQ: Because of COVID-19, I refrained from going back home for about a year and a half.  
AJ: Understood. There may be an increase now since we couldn't go out before.  
EQ: The expressway was crowded on the 14th, especially towards the city.  
AJ: It's a U-turn. Obon is over, and the test results are in.  
EQ: That sounds concerning. It’s been five days since I got home, but I’m still okay.  
AJ: If five days pass, it should be okay. People usually feel unwell about three days later.  
EQ: Understood. When it happens, the whole family gets affected, so it’s better if we don’t get it.  
AJ: True. There are people around me whose families had to recuperate at home.  
EQ: It seems to be like that everywhere now. My brother is in Tokyo, and food was sent to him.  
AJ: Understood. They are distributing a considerable amount of food. People in hotel quarantine said the bento boxes are not very tasty.  
EQ: Food is mostly ready-to-eat, so fresh foods were bought online. It’s convenient.  
AJ: Agreed. The widespread use of the internet is beneficial.

EQ: Good evening.
BO: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
EQ: Have you done anything enjoyable recently?
BO: Yes, I attended a summer festival last Sunday.
EQ: That sounds great! Were there many people?
BO: Yes, many attendees, including some of my favorite artists.
EQ: I'd love to hear more about it. Can you tell me?
BO: Certainly! Do you often listen to music?
EQ: Not as much lately, but I enjoy music.
BO: There are festivals with both Western and Japanese music. You might enjoy them.
EQ: Where was this festival held?
BO: It was Summer Sonic in Makuhari.
EQ: That's a large venue, right?
BO: Yes, it has multiple stages. I walked a lot that day.
EQ: Walking over 20,000 steps must have been exhausting!
BO: Yes, I walked more than 20,000 steps.
EQ: You must have been quite hungry afterward!
BO: There were many food stalls, so I had plenty to eat.
EQ: Did you sing along with any of the artists?
BO: Many overseas artists performed, and the crowd was very enthusiastic.
EQ: Were there any artists you recognized?
BO: I don’t usually listen to Western music, so I didn’t recognize any.
EQ: What’s your favorite music genre?
BO: I went specifically to see ONE OK ROCK.
EQ: That must have been thrilling!
BO: Yes, it was exciting, but also very hot.
EQ: It’s important to stay hydrated in such conditions.
BO: I made sure to drink a lot of fluids.
EQ: Enjoying good food and music must have been very satisfying.
BO: It was indeed very fulfilling.

EQ: Good evening.
BO: Hello. How can I assist you tonight?
EQ: Have you encountered any issues lately?
BO: My body feels increasingly heavy.
EQ: Do you mean you've gained weight?
BO: Yes, and my movements are sluggish.
EQ: Do you know why that might be?
BO: It could be due to a lack of exercise.
EQ: That makes sense. Many people feel less active these days.
BO: I used to be more active too, but now it's difficult.
EQ: The pandemic has made it harder for many people to go out.
BO: Exactly. I plan to exercise at home, but it's hard to stay motivated.
EQ: I recently joined a women-only gym. It could be a good option for you.
BO: That sounds interesting.
EQ: It's quite popular and comfortable, as everyone there is a woman.
BO: That peace of mind sounds beneficial.
EQ: The staff is friendly and supportive, and there are many elderly members.
BO: Are the staff members women as well?
EQ: Yes, all of them.
BO: That sounds great. I wish there was one nearby.
EQ: Some gyms offer 30-minute workouts which might fit your schedule.
BO: There are many gyms around, but I haven't seen a women-only one.
EQ: It may not feel like a typical gym. It suits a slower pace and varied needs.
BO: I understand. A hardcore gym can be intimidating.
EQ: I once overdid it at a regular gym, so this is a better fit for me.
BO: Taking it at your own pace is important.
EQ: It’s convenient since the whole trip takes just an hour.
BO: That sounds very practical. I might try to find one.
EQ: Please do search for it. Exercise can boost both physical and mental health.
BO: Thank you. I'll definitely look into it.

EQ: Hello.
EV: Hello.
EQ: Do you like animals?
EV: I haven't had one, so I can't say.
EQ: What animals come to mind?
EV: Cats and dogs.
EQ: Have you thought about having one?
EV: Not really, it seems challenging.
EQ: I had a dog as a child.
EV: Was it big?
EQ: No, medium-sized.
EV: Puppies are cute.
EQ: It was a puppy and followed me around.
EV: Watching it grow must have been rewarding.
EQ: Yes, it was special.
EV: Barking might disturb neighbors.
EQ: Now, most dogs are kept inside to avoid that.
EV: Indoor dogs can still be heard sometimes.
EQ: Even large dogs are kept indoors now. It must be tough for them.
EV: It might feel cramped for the dog.
EQ: Keeping a dog outside was challenging but enjoyable.
EV: Managing a dog requires commitment, like daily walks.
EQ: It’s impressive how people manage daily walks.
EV: It takes time and dedication.
EQ: Pets might be best for children.
EV: Children usually have more free time.
EQ: Pets can enrich life.
EV: It's good to gain experience with pets while young.
EQ: I enjoyed playing with my dog.
EV: That sounds like it was a special time.

EQ: Hello.  
EV: Hello.  
EQ: Do you prefer coffee or tea?  
EV: Tea.  
EQ: What kind of tea specifically?  
EV: Barley tea.  
EQ: Great choice, especially in summer.  
EV: Green tea upsets my stomach.  
EQ: Warm green tea soothes mine.  
EV: It has a diuretic effect, so I avoid it.  
EQ: It helps with constipation and dehydration.  
EV: I'll consider it next time.  
EQ: Coffee makes me go to the restroom often.  
EV: I drank coffee during exams.  
EQ: Did the caffeine help you stay awake?  
EV: Not really, it didn't work well for me.  
EQ: It didn't work as a stimulant?  
EV: That's right, I still felt sleepy.  
EQ: You can drink coffee before bed and sleep well?  
EV: Yes, that's true.  
EQ: I can't sleep at all if I drink coffee.  
EV: It seems to have a stronger effect on you.  
EQ: It also increases my stomach pain when it hurts.  
EV: That's tough if you like coffee.  
EQ: I love coffee, so I drink green tea instead when that happens.  
EV: I've stopped drinking coffee when I'm sleepy.  
EQ: What do you drink instead?  
EV: Water, to sleep peacefully.  
EQ: Good choice, water can be quite refreshing.  
EV: I don't want to wake up just to go to the restroom.

EQ: Hello!  
FW: Hello! How can I assist you today?  
EQ: Do you often drink coffee or tea?  
FW: I drink a lot. I particularly like coffee, but I try to drink decaf.  
EQ: Why is it decaffeinated?  
FW: My body is too sensitive to caffeine, and it affects my sleep.  
EQ: Understood. I avoid coffee at night for the same reason.  
FW: Do you like tea as well?  
EQ: Yes, I enjoy various types. Herbal tea isn't my favorite, though.  
FW: Do you have a favorite type?  
EQ: Probably green tea.  
FW: Do you have specific preferences for tea leaves?  
EQ: Not really. My father's family home was in Shizuoka, so I'm used to drinking it.  
FW: Understood. People from Shizuoka likely have many opportunities to drink tea.  
EQ: Yes, I've also had Kukicha.  
FW: I'm unfamiliar with Kukicha. Can you explain?  
EQ: It includes the stem part instead of just leaves.  
FW: Does it taste different?  
EQ: It's lighter but easy to drink.  
FW: Noted.  
EQ: Tea is good for beauty, possibly due to vitamins.  
FW: It contains many vitamins.  
EQ: Green tea seems to soothe my stomach.  
FW: Does it make you feel better?  
EQ: Yes, when I'm unwell, I drink green tea instead of coffee. It warms my stomach.  
FW: Understood.  
EQ: In the summer, I drink barley tea, but warm tea is more calming.  
FW: Warm tea is relaxing, with a soothing aroma.  
EQ: There might be a psychological effect. I need to buy more soon.  
FW: Noted.

EQ: Hello!  
DF: Hello! How can I assist you today?  
EQ: What time did you wake up today?  
DF: I woke up at 8 o'clock.  
EQ: Is that later than usual?  
DF: Yes, a bit later than weekdays. How about you?  
EQ: I've been struggling to wake up early.  
DF: I understand. Waking up early can be tough, especially when the weather changes.  
EQ: Cooler weather makes it harder to wake up.  
DF: Cooler weather can indeed make it harder to get up. It’s cozy in bed, isn’t it?  
EQ: I took out my comforter yesterday.  
DF: That sounds like a good idea. Do you think it will get colder soon?  
EQ: I need to switch my clothes soon.  
DF: Sounds like a good idea. Transitioning between seasons can be tricky.  
EQ: It’s a shame if they’re new summer clothes.  
DF: Yes, it can be a bit disappointing, especially with new T-shirts and tank tops.  
EQ: How about layering with a jacket?  
DF: That’s a great idea! Layering can be stylish and practical.  
EQ: Show only what you want to show!  
DF: I’ll definitely try that. Have you bought any fall clothes yet?  
EQ: Not yet, but soon.  
DF: I saw some nice options online. It might help to gather ideas first.  
EQ: It’s good to gather ideas first.  
DF: Definitely. Online shopping is convenient for that.  
EQ: I enjoy online shopping. Any favorite sites?  
DF: I often use ZOZO TOWN. They have a good selection.  
EQ: ZOZO TOWN sounds good. I haven’t tried it yet.  
DF: Check it out when you have a chance.  
EQ: I will.  
DF: Please do, and happy shopping!

EQ: Hello!
DF: Hello!
EQ: Is COVID-19 spreading recently?
DF: I live in Tokyo, and while it's calmer than during the peak period, I caught it last month.
EQ: Oh no! Can you tell me your symptoms, please?
DF: Initially, I felt discomfort in my throat, followed by a sore throat.
EQ: Did you have a fever?
DF: Yes, my fever reached the high 37 degrees Celsius but subsided within a day.
EQ: Thank you for sharing that. I'm sorry if it brings up any bad memories.
DF: It's okay. My throat hurt, but I still had an appetite.
EQ: It’s still quite worrying because the situation isn’t fully resolved yet.
DF: It is concerning. If you experience throat discomfort, it might be a sign to watch out for.
EQ: I’ll make sure to pay attention to any throat issues.
DF: With the virus being widespread, it's not surprising if someone gets infected.
EQ: Even at hair salons, they advise against wearing masks. Why is that?
DF: At beauty salons, masks can interfere, especially during hair coloring.
EQ: I understand. It can be quite troublesome around the ears, I suppose.
DF: Yes, particularly around the ears. For those who prefer less conversation, silent salons are appreciated.
EQ: I usually talk with my hairstylist, but being considerate is important in customer-oriented businesses.
DF: Definitely. I recently had my hair cut short.
EQ: That’s quite a big change.
DF: It's been a while, but it's so easy to manage now.
EQ: Did something prompt this change?
DF: I wanted a change of pace, especially after feeling down during the coronavirus period.
EQ: You must feel refreshed, especially with the high humidity recently.
DF: Yes, it gets humid when a typhoon is near.
EQ: My hair frizzes in humidity. It’s so frustrating.
DF: It becomes harder to manage, indeed.
EQ: I think my hair texture has changed lately too.
DF: Changes in hair texture can occur.

EQ: Hello!  
EV: Hello, nice to meet you.  
EQ: Do you have siblings?  
EV: Yes, I have a younger sister.  
EQ: So, you're the older one. I'm the younger in my family.  
EV: That's right.  
EQ: I have an older brother who's three years older than me.  
EV: My sister is six years younger.  
EQ: That's quite a difference. Do you enjoy conversations?  
EV: I don’t usually start them. My sister is quite talkative.  
EQ: It sounds like you interacted with your sister.  
EV: Yes, mostly when I was trying to concentrate.  
EQ: I can understand that.  
EV: It’s better now that we don’t live together.  
EQ: I also tend to prefer my own company.  
EV: Occasional interactions are just right.  
EQ: We argued a lot when we were together.  
EV: Different personalities can cause that.  
EQ: Absolutely. We communicate better now with some distance.  
EV: The distance feels right.  
EQ: A three-year gap with different genders is subtle but impactful.  
EV: Our hobbies were different too.  
EQ: Being seen as immature by my brother was tough.  
EV: Three years isn’t much now.  
EQ: A child’s three years and an adult’s three years differ a lot.  
EV: Yes, younger people can seem mature.  
EQ: Now I don’t focus much on age differences when talking to people.  
EV: It depends on the person.  
EQ: I get nervous around much younger people.  
EV: For me, it’s the opposite.

EQ: Hello!  
BV: Hello! How can I assist you today?  
EQ: Do you watch videos often?  
BV: I frequently watch video streams.  
EQ: I also watch YouTube often!  
BV: What type of videos do you enjoy watching?  
EQ: "It's a variety of things, but mostly stretching, audition shows, and cooking."  
BV: That sounds interesting. Can you tell me more about audition programs?  
EQ: Originally, it's a program called "Got Talent" on America's AGT.  
BV: Ah, you're talking about that well-known show?  
EQ: Susan Boyle is famous, isn't she?  
BV: Yes, I have heard of her. Is the show quite engaging?  
EQ: It's interesting. Various people appear, from small children to adults.  
BV: That sounds diverse. Do participants perform different acts?  
EQ: There are a lot of songs, but there are also dances and various other things.  
BV: I see. YouTube indeed has a variety of content.  
EQ: "It's convenient, isn't it? Recently, I've been cooking while watching YouTube."  
BV: That's a creative way to use YouTube. I hope you're enjoying it!  
EQ: The other day, I tried making a Taiwanese castella cake that I was interested in!  
BV: What is Taiwanese castella like?  
EQ: "It has a fluffy and chewy texture. It has a gentle sweetness."  
BV: That sounds delightful. Were you able to make it at home?  
EQ: "I made it with a rice cooker! I've never seen it sold in stores."  
BV: Noted. How did it turn out?  
EQ: "It was quite delicious. Please try searching for Taiwan castella. You will find many results."  
BV: I will look it up. It sounds worth trying. Thank you for sharing!  
EQ: By the way, I used rice flour instead of wheat flour, and it turned out delicious.  
BV: Interesting. How did it work out?  
EQ: Recently, I use rice flour for everything instead of wheat flour, but it's okay.  
BV: That's quite adaptive. I'm impressed!
